caption: Great food, great staff & great owners!  The Pavani is delicious!
Awesome pizza with great service.
Lucca  pizza is delicious.  Authentic Brick oven pizza with the freshest ingredients!    We have been to Italy, and this is as authentic!   Delicious! !  The owner,  Vick is so personable!
Awesome pizza
Best BOP ever!  Like I'm in New York!  Actually better, lol!
Our go to pizza place. So so good. Nuff said. Do it!
Number one pizza place in Roswell, ordered several times. The NY cheese pizza is my fav, but the pizza lucca is great as well.
the pizza is really good
The best pizza and excellent service.
Very good pizza. Thank you
Very disappointed in the pizza.  Flavorless sauce, crust was overcooked and dry. No warning that the sausage is a bit spicy.   I wont be coming back.
Wonderful and speedy service. My pizza was cut flawlessly and the young man, Austin, who delivered it to my car was so polite and respectful. Will be returning when back in town!
Delicious pizza!  Give them an extra star for operating safe through the pandemic!

A great example of a business handling the pandemic right! Had someone coordinating between arriving cars and the servers running the food out. (Obviously it's takeout only right now). If I'd known itd be this level of service I would have tipped better (the one shortfall of online ordering imo). I will next time for sure!
The best ny style pepperoni pizza in a 30 miles radius at least!
Amazing pizza, best pizza around. The pizza luccia and the standard pepperoni have out done all the other pizza places in ga.

We love this place! First reason is that the pizza really tastes original. We have moved from Italy 8 years ago, my husband born and raised all his life in Naples really knows how to judge Neapolitan pizza... And this is the closest to home we can get. Also, during the pandemic, the owner decided to offer curbside delivery only, no dine-in (which we prefer anyway) and even then all employees wear masks and gloves at all time, even if they are not in contact with any clients. It's the most safe environment we found to eat out. You get the greatest flavors and the safest environment...for me it's just the best!!

The best wood fire thin crust pizza in East Coob/Roswell. It was our first time here and we love it!! We had the NY Cheese and the Fig Bianco, both were amazing!! It is curbside pick up only and service was fast.
Great Pizza. Totally worth a try!

I stopped by and picked up the Meatball Peppadew! Unbelievable pizza, honestly this place rivals Anticos for the best pizza in Atlanta! The wood fire crispy crust with the smoked Peppadew peppers was mouthwatering! If you are in Atlanta, make the side trip up to Roswell to visit this gem! You will not be disappointed!

Very good woodfired thin crust pizza. The dining room is closed, but there was plenty of outdoor seating on the front and rear covered porch. We ordered by phone, the wait was a little longer than expected. The pizza came quickly and was hot. We had two different types and both were very good.
So yummie... and dining on the porch was fun.
I had the Fig and Prosciutto pizza which was excellent.
Amazing pizza!! Awesome service and very safe/clean during COVID!
Great pizza selections. Dough is chewy than others and tastes even better microwaved the next day. I will definitely return.

I eat a decent amount of pizza. I've eaten quite a bit in my lifetime. However Lucca is definitely my favorite I've ever had. The dough, the sauce, the way its cooked in the brick oven...its perfect. This is my wife and I's favorite spot. I'm drooling as I write this review. Make sure to grab some of their Lucca sauce to go with the pizza. I'll be grabbing some tonight.

Pizzeria Lucca was awesome, especially during this covid affected times. They greeted us when we pulled in and were super friendly. Food for takeout was great and provided quickly. Would recommend if you want pizza locally!
I absolutely love this place. Great pizza and friendly staff. Pizza is expensive but is well worth it with the quality of the ingredients. I only wish they were closer to Dunwoody!
Hands down the best Pizza in town.
Delicious pizza. Can't miss.
Our favorite pizza place!

Love this place. It’s another great option for authentic Italian pizza. You should definitely give it a try. My favorite is the prosciutto pizza, it has a bold and fresh flavor at the same time. My advice is that you get some olive oil and Parmesan from the sauces table next to the kitchen and spread it on top of your pizza, yummy! We always order “large” size and it’s enough for 2-3 people. Their staff is great too!
Pizza is generally great. Would give 5 stars, but last time the pizza wasn't tasty. Don't know what happened, maybe they were too busy and quality dropped a bit. Will come back.
Pizzeria Lucca is great. <y kids love when I order form here!
The best pizza you can get in Roswell.

This place is remarkable neapolitan style pizza.  The chew of the crust and the freshness of the ingredients say it all.  They nail it on this style of pie.  The staff is engaged and positive.  They do an amazing job of meeting cars in the lot and delivering carry away.  Ordering on line is very easy.  We hope they stay in our hood a long time!
Pizza was very tasty was left in oven a little longer than I like...crust was burned in spots

Love this place!! The pizza is delicious, not too much stuff on it, but what is there is so tasteful! The last two times we have been there, the restaurant is closed for sitting indoors, but the employees are out in the parking lot taking orders and delivering takeout. We have found these employees to be very courteous and helpful. Pizza is comparable in price to other pizza restaurants. When we have gone these last times, wine bottles and beer have been half priced!! Excellent!
Convenient location and good local pizza

The food is delicious, I think it is better than Antico to be honest. The atmosphere is great you can see the chefs make pizza almost right in front of you, you see the ingredients they put in their pizza, and it’s very friendly, they have free water, which is good for pizzeria’s because a lot of pizzeria’s will charge you even for water but not Lucca's also they have a 100 on their health score so I felt very safe eating there
This place has the best meat loveers in town! been dreaming about it since pandemic lockdown. Curbside pickup is immensely helpful!

We don’t post reviews, ever, but we had to make an exception for Lucca!  Friends recommended that we try their pizza so we did. We ordered in advance, showed up a little early and are so happy we did. There was a couple having a picnic in the parking lot and the woman working the lot was checking on them while she answered questions from other customers about the GORGEOUS tree in the middle of their lawn, if they were planning on opening the dining room and if they ever took a break. I found out after talking to her myself that she and her husband are the owners. We can see why our friends love this place so much. The food is AMAZING, the owners are AMAZING and they make us want to come back without even having set foot inside their beautiful building. Well done Lucca!  We look forward to many delicious meals in years to come.
Wow! Best quarantine pizza all month. Great job Luca we will be back for more!

We picked up (curbside delivery) a large prosciutto pizza last night for dinner. We loved the thin crust and the flavor profile. While we are limiting our take-out meals, we feel that we need to support some of the small businesses that are offering curbside pickup. If you are looking for ideas for an easy meal, definitely give them a try. I was able to pull up at the front door and the pie was delivered to my car.
Great pizza. Lots of options.

I absolutely love this place, never tasted pizza like this before, it’s delicious, however extremely over priced, almost double what they should be charging, if you have a large family your going to be spending a lot of money, a pizza large enough for just 2 people is about 22 dollars. So be prepared to spend a fortune if you come in with more than 1 person...
Cool vibe tucked a few blocks down from downtown Roswell. The pizza is one of the best in the area, no doubt.
Pizza was fine.  Availability of water was limited to about a six ounce cup.
Deee-licious! Fig, prosciutto, and arugula - wow! The owner, Deanna, was super nice with a wonderfully welcoming smile. Tables and floors were super clean. 100% will be returning.
Food is amazing, good customer service. Really good brick oven pizza!!
Great family friendly pizza.
Upbeat atmosphere, fresh and fast pizza and great cheesecake!
This is the BEST thing crust pizza EVER! Everything was so fresh and crisp!
Fantastic thin crust pizza and super nice owners and staff.

The pizza here is simply amazing, very delicious and well cooked. The atmosphere is wonderful and the entire place is spotless and well decorated. All of the staff were extremely kind & attentive, you could just feel the positive energy. We came on a recommendation from a friend and it was an excellent one, can't wait to be back!!
Surprisingly adaptive to a dairy allergy. The pizza was delicious and the handled our party of 14 just perfectly.
Fast service, would be even greater if they had fountain drinks
Great place, great food!!!  But little parking, Friday and Saturday you will be lucky to find a spot, drove around 4 times before I found a park.
It was ok
If you have a large party this is an easy pick.  They have large tables and quick service. Great pizza and salads in a bright and open space.
Pizza was delicious, crust was light, airy, and soft. Friendly service and casual atmosphere.
Not impressed with the atmosphere or food.

Excellent Pizza and Fast Service. My family enjoyed great pizza this last Friday at Pizzeria Lucca. Even though the restaurant was very busy, the service was great and the food was even better. We had both the Focaccia (as an appetizer) and Prosciutto Pizza which had a Thin and Crispy crust. True Italian style. Even our very picky 5 year old enjoyed the pizza! Not quite as good as Antico in Alpharetta but much less crowded and more of a family friendly environment. Our only complaint was the parking was hard to come by around the restaurant.
Great, low key pizza place. It's really casual. You order at the counter and sit on big wooden benches, but the pizza is top notch.
Some of the pizza in roswell
Food was delicious!
Pizza was too thin, toppings were sparse and overall too expensive for the bland pizza.
So good! Great atmosphere with options for everyone
Great pizza! 10x better than Antico's and better owners. Will definitely be back when I'm in Roswell.
Great pizza, great staff, great wine....hurry up and go already!!
Amazing food and service. Thank you!
Fast service,  absolutely no waiting. Great family place. Pizza is the BEST.
The pizza is phenomenal! Such a great place.

Pizza crust not crispy, noisy place!  Definitely for parents and kids.  You can not even carry on a conversation for kids yelling and running around the restaurant while parents eat at a separate table from their really young children
Authentic imported from Italy brick ovens. Pizza cooks fast and delicious. There's nothing like a real Sicilian pizza.
Awesome pizza and kid friendly! Definitely on the Terminator "I'll be back" list.
Best pizza. A must go.
Awesome pizza!
My kids love this place...
Great pizza.
Good food service lacks
Best pizza is Atlanta area!
Best pizzeria in town. Bar none
Visit to my Sister and her family began with pizza from Lucca. Superior service and maybe the best pie I have had in years!. And I am a life long New Yorker!
Delicious!!!
BEST. PIZZA. EVER. Can’t say enough about this place. Amazing food, nice wines and beers and everybody is so nice!  So worth the drive!

Pizza without draught beer? What a crime/don't waste your time. 》Check out Mellow Mushroom, Pepperoni's Tavern, Campania Italian, or even Carlisle's Pizzaria for even for the best pizza and plenty of good beer.
Perfect crust.  Need I say more?
The best Neapolitan pizza in metro Atlanta.
Very disappointing, we had a 6:40 pick up time for to go.  Actually got the pizza at 7, and it was cold.
This is your go to Pizza Place in the suburbs. The pizzas are simple yet delicious and unlike Antico, you can substitute/add ingredients to make it your own pie.

Having visited Italy many times I know very well what a good Neapolitan pizza looks and tastes like. Well, now you don't have to go to Italy to enjoy a great pizza; you find it a Pizzeria Lucca. Great pizza, friendly service and overall a very pleasant experience.
(Translated by Google) It is a very good family restaurant, and its wood-roasted pizzas are the best  (Original) Es un restaurante muy familiar muy bueno, y sus pizzas asadas en leña son lo máximo
Wood fired pizza is the best in Atlanta! You really need to stop by and try yourself....
It's simply the best
The pizza is simply fantastic.
Delicious wood fired pizza, served fast, community seating. Neapolitan pizza.
Good pizza and very friendly staff

This place blew my socks off! I'm not naturally a pizza person, but from the moment I drove into the parking lot the aromas coming out of this place took over my body. Whatever pizza you get, YOU HAVE TO ADD CARAMELIZED ONIONS! Trust me you won't be disappointed. The pizza is Great, and a large can feed a small family. BYOB on Mondays. And it's super clean! Everyone was really friendly as well. I'm definitely coming back
The pizza was amazing and you can tell the difference in the quality of the ingredients.
Love it.

The service was friendly and attentive. However, everything from the marinara to the cheese on the pizza was heavily salted. I understand its a pizza place...but the amount of salt made it so that it was difficult to enjoy. The ambiance was great though.
Pricey, but very good food and excellent service. Great beer/wine choices! Atmosphere very inviting.
The pizza was out of this world amazing. Yummy. We will definitely return.
Good pizza

Parking is an issue. Very few spaces in the small lot . There is a street behind it where cars park on both sides. The building exterior is attractive. The inside is one large area with communal tables and bench seating. You order at the counter just inside the main entrance.  A menu board would have made deciding what to order easier as apposed to the printed menus on the counter . We didn't know what they served until we got to the counter. If it had been busier the extra time ordering would be an issue. We odered the Meatball appetizer and a Margarita Pizza. We paid at that time and I left a tip but it wasn't clesr who I was tipping , the food runner/ busser , the order taker, the cook or the owner ? The Meatball appetizer consisted of 3 meatballs in marinara and some shaved parmesan and two pieces of bread . It was good but nothing special. The pizza was brought to us by the runner in just a few minutes . The pies are baked in wood ovens like those from Naples ( which these may be , I'm not sure). The high temperature means the cook time is very quick however our pie was not cooked through.  The dough was still a little raw in spots where it was thicker and there was no color to the bottom of the thin crust. The sauce was kinda watery and the small amount of cheese slid  around if you weren't careful. Taste was very good though. If we return ( which may not happen due  to the nearly 20 mile ride from home ) we would ask them to be sure to cook the pizza better. There  have been several of the Neapolitan style pizza places opening in the Atlanta area, Antico being my favorite and Fuscos in Acworth is very close for us and very good. Overall,  Lucca is good but a little short of great . I feel that if the pie had been cooked better the whole experience would have been better. UPDATE: 09/29/19  came back and we're glad we did . Pizza was great and we are very happy. Much improved since first visit
The pizza here is always delicious. It's located near downtown Roswell which is great for going on a stroll after pizza. Customer service is excellent. It's a special place.

Simply best pizza in Atlanta area. Taste is just unique. Staff is very friendly and place is clean and neat. It's a nice experience to stop by there and drink some wine and have some pizza with your family and/or friends

Can't judge a book by it's cover.  Great looking building and a lot of good reviews.  But once inside the truth comes calling.  Was  not greeted by any of the nine employees present, including the owners.  Confusing ordering process, likened to a fast food establishment.   Atmosphere in dining area, well it just wasn't there.  Picnic tables and sparse décor (okie dokie). Paid $30.00 for a pizza, a glass of water, and a $3.50 plastic bottle of tea.  Ordered a Greek salad,  never made it to the table.  Owner came out and told me it was not on my ticket. (alrighty then.)  Pizza came very fast with sparse ingredients , crust not done and very chewy.  Ate  on two aluminum pans,  which I presumed are also used to house the small pizzas.  Asked waiter for utensils , napkins, and  a pizza spatula.   I was  told they were inside and they did not use spatula's there.  (alrighty then)  Utensils were located on a table inside housed in two dishwasher holders.  Literally being touched by everyone who has boldly gone before you.  (Have been in the business, Health Department situation.)  Also asked for napkins and was handed a roll of towels that were bathroom hand towels.   I'm going to stop here because I am not angry, rather disappointed.  I support local business when I can, and truthfully drove 26.5 miles to visit Pizzeria  Lucca.  I give it one star for being over rated, over priced, and very disappointing.  To the owners, this is a tough business to be in,  I know, but if you're going to do it, then do it right.  One day you will run out of friends and family to write good things about you.  By the way , those are beautiful pizza ovens.
This was great, best crust and toppings, ex cellent staff. Thank you
Delicious Pizza! Nice service! Good price!
In Roswell to visit friends and they took me here. What a delight. The food was great and the fun dining atmosphere is family style with long tables to sit at. Wonderful place and I will return.
I don't care what no one says the pizza was excellent and the drinks blew my mind I left home tipsy full and satisfied. 💯😜😁😋😊
Place is amazing.  Tree out front over 100 years old.  They burn their crust tho
You can taste the quality and will know the owners love what they do because their food reflects that. Get the Lucca. Wood fired pizza is the best! Thank you.
Brick oven pizza. Bomb
We love this place, brick oven pizza, salads & other meals are very, very tasty. My husband & I go there almost every Friday. The sangria was delicious!

We are regulars at Lucca - admit to being pizza snobs.  Our pizza has to be wood-fired & only the finest ingredients.  Lucca has all that and friendly service.  We enjoy sitting out on the back porch near a magnificent oak tree.  Our pup, Howie, is welcome there.  Really is one of our favorite  places to be!
Tasty pizza and the nicest people work here! I’m usually wrangling a toddler and a baby, and they employees always ask me if I need any help while dining in.  Prices are very reasonable.
Food was exceptional.   Service and atmospheric wonderful.  Will come again and again.  Great job!
Pizza great. Why not have a dessert pizza??
We take our pup for lunch and eat the meatball appetizer out on the covered porch.  Delicious food and friendly staff
Great place for pizza!  We loved the food, the atmosphere, the staff, and the owners didn’t stop moving the entire time we were there.

I loved this place, the staff is super friendly and patient. They also give great recommendations. I have a preschool aged daughter who is very particular about her pizza and they were very accommodating. I haven't even gotten to the food yet! Normally I am more of a NY style pizza fan but this Neapolitan style pizza with the chewy crust and was a cheesy God send that has me reevaluating a lot of my life choices. I'll be back, hope to see you there!

We stopped in after friends from our hometown in Italy suggested we try them out and I am so glad we did!!  We had their margherita and it tasted like home. Their salads and the wine selection were both also amazing and the owners both took the time to welcome us and make us feel like we were at home. I recommend to anyone looking for authentic Neapolitan pizza.
Crazy Good Pizza!  Fun atmosphere and super pizza!
(Translated by Google) Great service, friendly and attentive. And of course some spectacular pizzas.  (Original) Un gran servicio, amable y atento. Y por supuesto unas pizzas espectaculares.
Excellent pizza and a solid wine list. It was our first time and the owner helped us decide on the Lucca and a wonderful bottle of wine. Looking forward to our next visit.
The fig and prosciutto is AMAZING!
The pizza is amazing! The staff is super friendly. We had an awesome experience and plan to go back very soon.

Really good, brick oven pizza. Decent prices and great restaurant for kids.  We will certainly be returning for eat in and take away.  I would recommend to anyone in the area looking for a good pizza at a fair price.
Loved it!  The staff, the food, the wine....outstanding!!
Friendly, helpful staff.  Outstanding customer service.  And the pizza is terrific - the crust, sauce and cheese blend into an alchemy of tasteful bliss.
It was good food just alil bit pricey.
I found the pizza not cooked enough. Sorry, I won't come back.
Decent pizza
Good pizza, many choices, wonderful atmosphere and nice staffs. 👍
Wonderful staff. Food is exceptional. Patios are lovely.

My friend and I visited on 7/27/19 or the first time. We learned of the restaurant on Atlanta Eats. YOU DID NOT DISAPPOINT. The food was really good and the staff was wonderful. We arrived near closing, but we weren't rushed in any way. It was a nice, family atmosphere. The pizza and lemoncello cake was awesome! We'll be back.

Horrible pizza and service. Couldn't understand our order even though my husband pointed straight at it and she confirmed verbally what he asked for. WE were served this disgusting pizza with cheese and fig preserves. When we asked to get our order corrected, they were rude to my husband. Pizza is also underdone. Will never return to this place and highly don't recommend.
Seriously the best pizza south of New York!!
Great pizza. Great staff. Support local.
Awesome brick oven pizza, great service...

Great pizza, in my opinion, the best anywhere in GA. The toppings are exceptional, not the usual run of the mill. Service is exceptional, the staff and owners are friendly and accommodating. Great place for family, it is very clean.....great place for casual dining. Have dined there several times and never been disappointed!

So very much enjoy the salads and the pizza!! Such a treat! It has. Our dinner at Pizzeria Lucca has become a weekly visit!! We tried the meatballs on the last visit and they were also so delicious!! Love, love, love  the sweet owners too!! They care about and are passionate about their restaurant and the food they serve! They always make us feel so welcome!
Excellent neapolitan pizza, outstanding service, and very clean place. Family friendly.

Favorite pizza in Marietta and favorite out of all visited OTP and in Atlanta.....owners really care about every customers visit and always make sure we had a good experience. Everyone looking for amazing homemade pizza, meatball appetizer, and always fresh ingredients look no further than Lucas!

I can’t say enough good things about Pizzeria Lucca. First off, the pizza is AMAZING!! I recommend the Meatball Peppadew or the Margarita. They have condiments for the pizza too, ask about the spicy Lucca sauce. The salads are very fresh and the appetizers are a great size to share. The Meatball Marinara appetizer goes quickly so if they have it, GET IT!! Best thing is everything comes out so quickly! Each time I come in it gets better and better...trendy decor, local beers, and the list goes on! Lucca is family owned and run, they do an amazing job!! Diana and Vic have put everything they have into making the experience at Lucca exceptional. I don’t think there will ever be a day I stop coming into Lucca. This is a great place to bring family and friends whether you are locals or from out of town. Lucca will make you feel at home with a great atmosphere and delicious food!
Fast service. Good pizza.

I LOVE Lucca’s pizza. Their pizza is the closest to what I have eaten in Europe. Lucca provides quality products (dough, sauce, cheese, toppings, olive oil) on pizza and it is that combination which makes their pizza stand out from their competitors. I love supporting local food places and Lucca’s pizza has not disappointed me ever. I love their consistency in services, quality, pizza taste, garlic bread, and clean ambience! What else would you look for in a pizzeria? Lucca has everything you are looking for! Highly recommend this place.
Very unprofessional staff
Good pizza, large portions. Unique flavors.  Wine overpriced for small cup you get.  Fast service.

While I really like the pizza I'll drive further for antico. Something is just missing. Looks like a pleasant atmosphere, but there's a mix of high end mixed in with low brow. Cheap comes to mind. The ingredients seem good, but the extras are just lacking. I find them to be rude and very curt. I just went to read some of the reviews. What a joke, small and pathetic person who fights with customer reviews. There's a pattern that this guy is super rude and especially about children. I didn't have children with me when I went in awhile ago, help me if I did. He, also, commented that he/she was at a funeral all week on one review. The reviewer never said once when they went in. My review is based over a month ago in experience. New flash, owner, reviews can be at any time. For me, I never write them close to my visit. My time is ljmited. Customer service is not consistent and it feels like they are doing you a favor. They are not. I'll spend my dining dollars elsewhere. They don't seem to care about winning my money anyway.

Pizzeria Lucca is more than amazing pizza. Pizzeria Lucca is filled with people who love what they do and care about each person who walks in the restaurant. Whenever we have family in town, we make sure to take them here. The pizza and appetizers have so much flavor and never fail to disappoint.  Vic and Diana pour their hearts into this place and make sure they get to know each and every customer on a personal level. I love seeing all the families and children come in and sitting on the patios watching the kids play by the trees. Pizzeria Lucca is a special place and is definitely the best pizza in town!!!!

First of all posting private info re: an ex employee and the personal events that occurred between you and him is highly unprofessional and blaming him for any forthcoming bad reviews is in poor taste and without class, especially being so highly defensive to customers as well who are relaying their experience in their point of view is something that I was shocked by. If you are confident in your confident in your behavior and your product you should not have to defend yourself so strongly, post private information on an employee, and place blame on them for reviews. I recently treated my mother to a special evening at Lucca's. We notice it everyday en route and finally decided to go and check it out. Upon entrance the employees we encountered made eye contact, were smiling and I felt they were sincerely polite and appreciative. The employees in kitchen did a fantastic job, pizza was delicious and I loved the variety and array of Italian toppings. My husbands family is from Sicily and this pizza is fresh, cooked exactly right. However I noticed a man, I assume he was manager or owner, who seemed very agitated with a table close to us that had 2 kids with them. You could feel the tension in the room, especially after I noticed how he spoke to the woman about her children. He was very icy in his demeanor towards her and children when the about 7yr old made a small outburst.  I agree you should maintain your children in a nice place, but sometimes something may just happen. Me and my husband and family have always owned successful businesses, and I have to say I have never myself, nor have I observed an owner write responses to comments in such a defensive manner when customers are simply relaying their experience. It is as if your are demeaning their viewpoint, and that is what a review is. I have no affiliation or know this person who was fired, but I can imagine how I would feel if this was done to me. You should have been professional and had no response publicly or a public reaction and handle it properly.
Our first time and it was a good choice. My wife's salad was ok but the pizza was great. Nice place.

Pizza ausabuqo is my favorite place in Roswell . My friends girlfriend works at pizza luciera so I decided to go. I was not disappointed when we showed up to pizza ausoria. The environment and workers are amazing at pizza bucoria. This will not be the last time I will be attending pizzeria  Lucca.
Pizzeria luca is a great little place with even better pizza. My friend Zavier introduced it to me because his girlfriend works there and I could not be more pleased! Great family atmosphere!
The closest to Italian Pizza thin style
1st rate pizza

I'm a former employee, during the short period of time I worked for Lucca I would have to say the food and staff are great (Aaron), the one thing I did notice for sure is that Lucca is not a child friendly restaurant ,for some reason Vic the owner takes it upon himself to discipline others kids for the smallest things he has a major disconnect when it comes to letting kids be kids especially at a pizza restaurant

Really wish I traveled to Atlanta more often than I do. This pizza was excellent! I thought I could never find pizza to top what I have had in the Detroit & Chicago area, but this amazingly was even better than any I have had before & the service was excellent too!!

I’ve came in to stop to try out the restaurant out, I had brought my little niece with me. I noticed the owner seemed rude towards us. I was observing the restaurant and could noticed the attitude change between the customer with and without kids. Needless to say the owner doesn’t seem to like kids.
Owner is a terrible employee he should stick to being the owner and get out of the kitchen
Very well decorated place and melt in your mouth pizza, beer and wine selections. After speaking with one of the employees I even found out they flew in the ovens from Italy, so that’s pretty cool!
Love the pizza
Pizza was great! Service was a little slow, considering it was empty when we arrived/ordered.

Pitiful excuse for a pizza place. You have family seating but there is no atmosphere of a family place. I’ve seen the “owner” yell at several customers children for doing no more than running. He is a joke, I’ve never seen someone so disrespectful to women and children.
Hot sauce
Nice
If you enjoy spicy food, I highly recommend the Tropea.  It pairs beautifully with a Peroni
Amazing pizza!!  Will definitely be back

The pizza is very good but the prices are very high for what it is. However, we were able to overlook the prices because the pizza is good, it’s closer than Antico and it has a family friendly atmosphere. However, our last experience was not a good one. As we were about to leave, my son and our friend’s son, stood up to play for no more than 30 seconds next to our table as we were packing up to leave. They were not doing anything wrong, just being kids, but unknowingly were in the path of the pizza runners. I noticed and was about to move them but before I could, the owner jumped in and made a rude comment to them/us. Based off of other reviews, this seems to be a common thread - a very low tolerance for kids in the restaurant. We felt unwelcome at that point and left quickly however not before spending over $70 for 2 small pizzas, a few beers and a salad. I felt a little robbed and a little offended at the same time. We take our kids out to eat often and have never seen a business owner act unprofessional like that. Furthermore, Lucca is a casual pizza place, albeit an expensive one, with picnic tables, rolls of paper towels on the table and no servers other than people dropping off their overpriced pizza. It is not a fine dining restaurant. Therefore, I would expect them to have a more hospitable approach to interacting with families with kids. Next time we’ll just go to Antico.
Good pizza, needed a little more cooking for the center..  no spatula to pick slices, need to use hands. Salad was delicious ambiance is okay, but prices high for quality.

The only bad thing about Lucca's is that once you have it- you won't want any other pizza ever again! Crust haters will even eat this crust because you won't want to leave a single bite on your plate.  The set up is super clean and organized, you can see every inch of the kitchen too. They aren't trying to hide anything. The pizza comes out really quickly and I like how simple the menu is.  Atmosphere is amazing and super chill on the patio. Seems like you're eating authentic Italian food at home in your own backyard!
Great Service and Great pizza!
Good pizza.
Not very friendly service but the pizza made up for it.

Fast, delicious pizza in a family style atmosphere. We visited this pizza joint for the first time yesterday. The pizza was thin crust and came out super fast. Maybe about 10 minutes from when we ordered to when it came to the table. You can see them cooking it right there in the brick ovens in one side of the restaurant. It's a big open hall-style room with long picnic tables so you can eat family-style. You come in and order at front counter, and then take your order number to your table and then they bring it out to you. The music was a little bit loud, but since it wasn't too busy we were able to hear each other easily. The parking was convenient and ample. Some people said it was expensive in the reviews. We paid $38 for a large pizza, an appetizer, and one drink. That fed me, my husband, and my toddler. I don't think that seems too bad to feed all three of us for 38 bucks.
Best pizza ANYWHERE!  I have traveled all over the world and this is the best pizza I have ever had.  Will.  Be.  Back.

The pizza was really nothing special. Most wood fire grills you can immediately tell the difference. This pizza dough was tasteless and there was a bitter after taste. I wouldn't go there again ! The service was nice though!
Very good pizza.  We ate the Blanca Salciccia.  We come here every year for our wedding anniversary.
Place was amazing pizza was fresh atmosphere was very welcoming would go there to eat anytime I'm in the area
Good pizza bad concept
Pizza was good, though a bit pricey. Nice casual atmosphere
Pizza was to die for! I will definitely visit again.

Best pizza in Ga!  Lucca is my kids’ favorite place to eat pizza.  Is it cheap?  Nope.  Are there TVs?  Nope.  Do my kids still ask to come back all of the time???  Yep!  The food ingredients are exceptional and the staff (including the owner) are as nice as can be.  We’re in there at least once a week and my 4 kids haven’t been yelled at yet.  I guess they know how to act in public.  To the ones that are upset cuz their kids can’t behave in a restaurant, you’re missing a good thing!
Has good  people and good food
Delicious food and friendly staff!
Great pizza!

We have been coming here to eat  since they opened . We tell everyone about pizzeria Lucca as we have lived in Roswell for 10 years and love supporting local business . I hate to give it one star as the food has always been delicious and the staff is so kind minus the owner ( Vick?) . He yelled at my children and myself tonight as we were leaving and they were running to the door . I was asking them to stop running but he took it to the next level. As a business owner myself,  I am shocked at his Behavior. This is a casual pizza joint swarmed with families . Maybe he is having a bad night but to disrespect anyone like this really shows his lack of professionalism. If I am mistaken please correct me but I am pretty sure he is the owner . Salt and pepper hair and he is always working in the back making pizza . I think his wife works there too and she has always been one of the kindest people I’ve met which is why we come back every week and tell our friends. The rest of the staff I would give 100 stars to and he is lucky he has team that makes up for what he lacks.   Really bad experience and we won’t be coming back which I’m sure Vick will be happy about since that is.what he told me when I was walking out the door, to not come back . Perhaps take another career path in a cubicle where you don’t have to interact with small children . Trust me, they were disciplined for running. There was no need to yell at your customers. Do not bring your kids here . Try fickle pickle on canton street!!
Best pizzeria in Roswell, probably all OTP
Great place, mediocre pizza.  We will go back to try again.   Love the concept and location.
Fast service and great food
Margherita was so good!

First time going pizza was light airy n yummy, Greek salad on point but the meatball oh my my. Order it and your taste buds will thank. Crew were nice props up to either the manager/owner came to our table personal to see if we were happy with the food. Will be back
Very fresh  and tasty pizza.

Nice family friendly pizza place in Roswell. We had salads and pizzas. The salads were salads, nothing special. The pizzas were neopolitano style cooked in wood fired ovens and served hot straight out of the oven. All of the several varieties of pizza we ordered were very good. We enjoyed relaxing on the outdoor porch and enjoying the afternoon with some great pizza.

Pizza place with a brick oven. It's handmade and  you order from a counter. You can watch them actually make the pizza. There are long tables to sit at but if it's a lot of people in your party you would need to get there early. I usually get take out. I would do a 5th star if it was more of a table service with hostess/host and servers.
Great pizza. Great family environment.

Amazing first experience! The staff, the cleanliness and the food was a great experience! It is a tremendous relief to find a restraunt where the entire staff is on point!!! Thank you all and May GOD Bless!!!

We love this place! The pizza is awesome! We get the peperonata. Excellent cheese and crust. The seating is indoor or outdoor. Picnic tables are indoors which we don't mind. The only negatives are it is a little pricey and sometimes parking is tricky. Additional parking is not far with a short 5 minute walk.
Delicious pizza in a family, friendly atmosphere. We enjoyed it.

Unfortunately due to Awful service experience I have to give 2 stars. I just can’t see myself coming back, although pizza is 4 stars for sure.  Price- pricy.  Food- Pizza was good, looks like they use proper ovens and good ingredients. We came for a very early dinner so there was only another table, pizza was ready in minutes. Some Reviews say best pizza in town, I’d disagree, Antico is still the best Neapolitan style pizzeria in the city.  Service- Make sure when the lady upfront repeats back your order- you hear it CORRECTLY, because if she entered it wrong, it’s now on you that you didn’t catch her mistake and got the wrong pizza. Zero accountability, very rude, and honestly, because of her we lost desire to Ever come back. That’s unfortunate.  Atmosphere- more like eat and go. Good concept with community tables but I can’t put my finger on where it falls short. Maybe 6-8 person tables, white walls, unfriendly cashier. I think there would be potential if the place would just buzz with fun and ease. It was just dull. Grey. Barely friendly. For the price point, nah.

Beautiful outside but inside has one large dining room plus kitchen. Sit at shared picnic tables. Kids might like it, but not great atmosphere. Had a large Pizza Lucca with two root beers. Cost 37.00 was not cheap. Toppings were very good. Crust was burnt yet doughy in the middle. No waitresses. Poured my own drink. They do bring food based on your number sign you set on table. Men's bath has louvered door. Weird using urinal right in front of door where you can hear easily through it. We will not return.

Oh my...this pizza is amazing!!! The owners are there and pizza is like you are in Italy!! Delicious. The meatballs side is also so yummy! Picnic style tables/open kitchen very casual fun family place!
Family style eating.   Absolutely delicious!
Prices too high
Very good!!!
Pizza is very good, thin style crust.
The best pizza in Atlanta hands down. High quality ingredients and brick fire ovens. Delicious!
As good as Antico without the wait
Best pizza I ever had in the US! We go there almost on a weekly basis.
Good pizza

The pizzas here are excellent - Neapolitan in style without being soupy in the middle (so ok, not really Neapolitan), the correct amount of toppings, nice, flavorful crust, on par with the best pizzas in NYC. I just wish the place had a cozier and more romantic atmosphere, and real glassware for the wine. I can see there picnic tables being really fun for families though, and service is great. I'll be back for the pizza regardless.
(Translated by Google) Excellent site  (Original) Excelente sitio
Great place with high quality pizza!

Food was very good however would have been much better had I eaten inside the restaurant rather than chosen to get carryout. The restaurant has open family style seating with great atmosphere for children and the cheesecake was stellar.
Best pizza in town!
Great New York style pizza. Family-friendly, picnic-style seating. Byob is allowed some nights during the week.
Best pizza I ever had.
Probably just a personal taste thing. I wasn't wild about the pizza. Others in my group liked it better than I did.

THANK YOU, THANK YOU!... I can't say, " thank you" enough. I am working on a television show down the street from this pizzeria, and I needed to feed my crew really late. I didn't want to go to a pizza chain, I wanted to support local businesses, with a mom and pop feel. I noticed this  restaurant closed at 9pm EST, and I was about to go to another store, and I decided to call, and the young lady placed me on hold, after I told her, " i know you close at 9, but I wanted to go to a local business and I need THIRTY PIZZAS, do you mind asking the owner if they mind staying open to fulfill this order"... She placed me on hold, and came back with the owner's permission to stay open and make the 30 pizzas for us!! THIS IS WHY I LOVE LOCAL BUSINESSES!!!! Thank you Vic and Diana..I will be back!!!!
Just ok

Reading some of these reviews has definitely confirmed that 20% of the people are 80% of the problems.  For those 20%, please stay away from Lucca.  Life is too short!  For my family, we'll keep enjoying some of the best pizza that we've ever had at Pizzeria Lucca.  We're in there every week.  Owners and staff are very pleasant and accommodating.  Pricing is a little higher than what we've been used to paying but we truly get what we pay for.   We've tried others in the Roswell/Alpharetta area and cannot find ANYTHING that competes (most have been very disappointing).  Congrats to Pizzeria Lucca on an excellent product!  #WyWySTRONG
Very tasty!
This is a great place for quality authentic pizza, fast service and plenty of seating.
Great pizza, friendly staff, and cozy place.

Hey guys, I’d be remiss if I didn’t defend this place! My husband and I take the kids here all the time and we’ve never had any issues. I would say this is a very friendly family oriented place. The food is amazing and so is the staff. As a matter of fact, I just left there! Love this place.
Service and food were good.  A little expensive.
Great pizza - only negative is if you're hungry it's very light

What a shame, this place is now NOT KID OR FAMILY FRIENDLY. This was a regular spot for family and soccer team gatherings but we are no longer wanted. I had introduced many families to this wonderful place over the past couple of years but we were scolded by the owner as we entered the restaurant that families coming together are not welcome. Embarrassing since I suggested it and a shame since we can’t support the family business any longer. If you don’t have kids, it will be nice and quiet for you!
Excellent and authentic Neapolitan style pizza! Park next door to the the west (downhill - NOT at the Mill) if the Lucca lot is full.
I would give it 3.5.  I prefer a soda fountain and wait staff vs buying bottled soda.  The Margherita pizza was cooked perfectly, but I wish the sauce had a bit more flavor.  Arugula salad was great.

First off Owners accommodated our toddlers off request for fresh cheese...Great customer service..... Then the pizza was great.... Reminded me off my time in upstate New York. Simple, light and delicious!!
Very lay back! Pizza is awesone

Hands down the best pizza in Atlanta!  We had two pizzas, the Fig Bianco and the Prosciutto.  The toppings were great and crust was just perfect.  Along with the good pizza, the restaurant ambiance was nice, service was great and building was charming.
Love the atmosphere of this place. The staff is very kind. Their pizza is my favorite pizza in Atlanta by far!!
My number one pizza.. yummmmmmy If you want the best pizza you must visit Pizzeria Lucca. Great place with great atmosphere. The owner is the nicest guy and very accommodating. Love this place.

We had a very poor experience here. We visited with young children, and they were clearly not welcome. The owner was extremely rude to them and us, the parents. We weren't there two minutes when we were accosted and reprimanded by him because he was upset my daughter was hugging and greeting her friends in the middle of the restaurant, and not at a table. He was afraid they were disturbing the other 5 families in the dining room, all of whom were preschool parents and part of the group we were joining! By the way, that evening was our preschool's spirit night, and we were there at the invitation of the owner!  We were so put off by his awful behavior we left without ordering.

NOT little kid friendly. Tonight was our school's spirit night at Pizzeria Lucca. As expected, there were a large number of families (each with 2 or 3 young children). During that time, many of the kids were playing and being loud (as kids do).  Our group was told by the owners that our kids were too loud and/or needed to sit down. They are kids at a pizzeria on SPIRIT NIGHT! There are much better ways to handle this situation, but we won't be giving them the chance to try as I can guarantee we won't be eating there again.

THE BEST PIZZA EVER for 2018!! I cant wait to go back. We went with the family and it was sooo good, the taste was perfect and the sald was good to. We sat outside and enjoyed our pizza and salad on a weekday!
Great place! Delicious pizza and kid friendly!
Most authentic and perfect italian style pizza! My fave place!
Delicious pizza and friendly staff make for an awesome place to eat!
Great pizza.  Dough is really good (like it was made yesterday).  Olive oil with minced garlic is available as condiment.
Great pizza /neat place/good service
Awesome authentic brick oven pizza, also loved the meatball appetizer.
Excellent pizza, clean place and very good service.
Great price, awesome tasting pizza.  Definitely reccomend
Great cheesecake and light but delicious NY style pizza's

Im originally from long island, New York so I know good pizza.  I consider myself a pizza connoisseur. Pizzeria Lucca, while highly recommended by friends was a bit of a disappointment for me. As seen in the picture, the pizza pie looks great but when you hold a slice and get a drastic flop like the one in the other picture, I knew it was gonna be a bust.  Whoever made the pizza seriously undercooked it.  Granted, the soggy crust may have been partially due to ordering this pizza to go and it sitting in the box in my trunk for 15 minutes. The pizza has major potential, nice thin crust, good cheese and sauce. I could see this being good if it were cooked longer.  Next time I'll eat inside the restaurant and give it one more shot. I'm hoping it was just an off day for whoever made this pizza.  *update* went here on Saturday  9/8 and ate inside. As I predicted, pizza looks great and has good taste but dough is extremely soggy. I will not be returning. I'm also convinced that people in Georgia dont know good pizza and that is why this place gets such high reviews. Take it from a new Yorker who is a harsh critic that this pizza isnt worth your time. When you hold a slice up and it flops (sags) it isnt gonna be good. Pizza needs to be crispy not soggy. And that's a review folks.
Great food, great looks and great taste
Good pizza.
Very pleased with the taste and texture of the pizza. Reminds me of a pizzeria from Richmond, VA that literally had the best tasting pizza I've had. This is a great alternative.
First time coming to this place , and they satisfied my taste ...they will see me coming in regularly now....
De-li-cious!!! And so fast!
Omg pizza is awesome!!! So consistent every time, love the ice and water station SO convenient. This place in my favorite!

Being from Brooklyn, it’s been hard to find real Pizza pretty much anywhere else. I am super picky about my Pizza. Found Pizzeria Luca and I finally feel home. It’s simply brilliant Pizza and more importantly, authentic Brooklyn style. Just the right sauce, fresh mozzarella, basil and the perfect crust. I go there every week and so happy to have this in my neighborhood.  I would highly recommend Luca. The ambience is non pretentious, very social and the owners are always out there taking care of customers and making sure the quality is perfect.  We need more places like these in Atlanta/ Roswell. I hesitated to give this review since I wanted it to be a local secret, but too late ! I think everyone who eats there is touched by its awesomeness ...
Probably the best pizza north of Atlanta
Fantastic, authentic, wood-fired pizza. Incredible meatballs, great service and fun atmosphere.
great pizza and atmosphere. must go
Best pizza north of the Chattahoochee!
Always good. No crowd now that school has started.

We really love coming here for pizza with the kids. Their pizza is very good, and the open seating and easy parking make it much easier to handle with the family than some of the other popular nearby pizza places.
Best pizza around!
Best pizza I've ever had!
Great pizza
They make a perfect thin pizza with just the right amount of "charring" on the crust.  I highly recommend the pepperoni.
As good a Neopolitan pie as I've had in Atlanta..
Best pizza in the area. It was hard to find a good one after moving from NY.
(Translated by Google) Excellent Italian flavored pizzas. I highly recommend it  (Original) excelente pizzas con sabor italiano.  la recomiendo ampliamente
Pizza was excellent.
Ok pizza, so so atmosphere but big prices.  Others are out there.
Great pizza Great service Great time This place is a MUST!!!!!!!!
Wood oven pizza, great tasting, can't go wrong if you want pizza.
A wood fired oven. A family restaurant. Kids playing in the yard beside a huge tree. The freshest ingredients. Melts in your mouth.  Fantastic customer service. A wonderful experience.
Great food
A little pricey. Burnt the crust.
Well worth the 2 hour drive!
Loved the pizza. Little bit pricey.
The Neapolitan pizza here is outstanding.
Good pizza nice atmosphere and great staff.
Pizza was great. Everyone was super friendly!
Fast, friendly, and delicious

Great food.  Friendly service. Very clean inside.  Showed up just before close and didn't feel rushed at all.  You order at the counter and go sit at one of the very large picnic style wooden tables or outside seating and they bring your food to you.  Drinks are all from a bottle or can.  Not fountain.  They have beer and wine options. And a water and ice maker machine for self service.  We built our own margarita pizza.  The sauce was on point and the dough wonderfully chewy but also still crunchy.  And not too much dough. It was a nice light dough on the thinner crust side, which I prefer.  Meats were good.  Not too greasy.  We'd go back.
Unimpressed.
Delicious wood-oven pizza.  Somewhat expensive.  Limited parking.
Pizza was cold upon arrival. No ranch oh yeah and the freaking LG pizza is 26.00 dollars! Trash! Never eating there again!
Great pizza in Roswell! Lucky it's so close to the house!

The location is spacious and comfy. The main room is as big as a warehouse, but it's ringed with counters and hanging signs that give it the look and feel of a local deli, and the long, heavy boardinghouse benches add a real down-home touch, like you would find in a big BBQ joint. Lots of people were eating on the patio, but we preferred to sit next to the three ovens, looming large in plain view. The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive. But it's all about the pizza, gang, and they do it very nicely. The star of the show is the crust. It comes out of the oven amazingly quickly--and the wood-fired heat makes it bubbly and airy on top and nicely marked and smoky on the bottom without being charred. The sauce is simple and tasty and you get enough of it--something that is becoming a real issue at so many other places trying to cut corners. P-L offers a good number of house pies and a decent selection of toppings if you prefer to build your own. We found the prices to be just right, compared with the other pizzerias around that go for quality over mass-production. Very good experience. We will be back!    (Previous reviews suggesting one drives down Mimosa, then turning right on Bulloch Ave are giving a great tip.)
Pizza is great when fresh!! Not a great re heat

First time at Pizzeria Lucca and we had a wonderful experience! The restaurant is so cute and has great porch for outdoor seating. The pizza was fabulous! So authentic and delicious! The owner even came out to check on us and spent time sharing his story. We look forward to going back again and again!
Phenomenal pizza and fantastic atmosphere!! We’ll be back.
Wonderful pie, great prices beers with our friends. Everything was amazing!!
Can be loud but goos food
Quick. Nice patio area. Limited parking.
I loved the pizza and my freinds and I had a good time.
The fig and prosciutto pizza was top notch! 😍

The atmosphere is great. The place is as cozy as comfortable and the staff is super attentive. All that plus great food makes this place one of the best pizzerias in this side of Atlanta. A must stop for something different. Don’t forget to tip your servers, they do more than what you see.

The staff is always friendly, and the pizza is great. The meatballs are good, too! It is now the only pizza we eat. If I'm too tired to est out, I pick it up on my way home. Great pizza, great people, great local business to support.

Neopolitan style pizza. Large bench, family style seating. Laid back but with upscale pizza/toppings. Beer and wine selection is limited but BYOB (and wine) on Monday and Tuesday. The small is a good size to split between two people, the large for three, maybe four if you have some light eaters. You can get full and out the door for $10-12 a person which feels increasingly rare these days. When I feel like neopolitan pizza, this is where I end up.  Edit: Owner takes an active interest in the success of the business, edited from 4 to 5 stars. Not every restaurant is going to be perfect for everyone. While I would prefer to have refills on drinks instead of the individual bottles, an assortment of beers on tap (cause everyone loves pizza and beer) and maybe a little more flavor in the meatballs (maybe a blend of different meats), that would all be nit picky.
Good pizzs
Fantastic !

Pizza here is fantastic. We have tried most of the pizza places in the Roswell area, and this place is great because:  We haven't seen any of the unique toppings they have here anywhere else.  The crust is the best! It's thin and crispy on the outside but is nice and chewy on the inside.  While it's more expensive than a chain (but not by much) the thing that stood out compared to other pizzerias is that for the same price here, you get a significantly larger pizza.  Excellent menu, friendly staff, and plenty of seating (inside and out).
Great pizza in a nice ambiance with friendly service.
Great as usual!

Great pizza. When you go in, you order in the front. Good variety of pizza. There are three different types of salad, that's a pretty decent size. Pizza has a chewy dough. We shared a large for three persons, which wasn't enough. I think the large pizza would have been perfect for two people (I like to eat). It has a nice, relaxing environment.

Way too expensive for what it is. No soda fountain, bench seating is deceptively small, only small and large options for pizza, wine is sitting out right at the entrance in the sun,  ice is a very awkward shape/ size, and very little "service". The whole operations of this restaurant just seems off, very generic and unsustainable. Pizza is great (which is the only good thing this restaurant has going for it), not very filling though.

Hands down my favorite pizza in Atlanta. I've been to all the other pizza places and would choose Lucca over any other one, every time. My husband and I typically have a date night weekly here while our daughter has a 90 minute kids program near our neighborhood.  We've been coming since it opened and every single time we have had excellent pizza, delicious salads, friendly staff and very fast service. We have brought many friends and family here and everyone has been thrilled. All the salads are good and more than enough unless you're the 6'5" dude who apparently needs 15 meatballs to be happy.  We've tired several different pizzas, all have been terrific. The owners, Vic and Diana, who we did not know before coming to Lucca, are WONDERFUL. I say that because we actually speak to them when we come to their restaurant. We've gotten to know them a little bit over the past (almost) two years. They love what they do, work incredibly hard to provide the best service and truly desire that people love their food. It is high time I posted a review so here I am and I just read the reviews. Bless you Pizzeria Lucca for feeding people. Seriously. Now it is time for me to review some of the reviewers: *Dear Kelsey, You could have ordered a small pizza, or two small pizzas. In one of our many chitty chars with the owner (because he is actually a person you can talk to) mentioned to us that they had run out of dough and they were just as surprised because they were slammed that day. Antico dude has a sign on his door that says will make pizza until he runs out of dough and every thinks he is a genius. *Dear Alicia who has never been to the restaurant and is basing her review of a reviewer she never met (insert all hysterical laughing emojis here...) There are sooooooooo many pizza places around. Tru dat. But there aren't sooooooooo many really really good pizza places around. You should try this place and then rescind your review. Indeed food reviews are hilarious. Yours is too. If I was you I'd want to be me too. *Dear Mihai, I have never expected any restaurant to provide a cup for my two year old. That is what a sippy cup if for. *Dear Dominic, Appetizers come in threes. It is a thing. Please pass the knife.  *Dear Lucca Staff, Thank you for being you. We love the food. And if we don't we tell it to your face. But we'd be nice about it : )))))))))))))))))))))))))))

Somewhat of a rip off of a popular Atlanta pizza spot. We had a good size crowd come in about an hour before they closed. While I admit, we did stay a bit longer than planned, we had no issue leaving. It was the way we were asked to leave that was the problem.

Great staff, great atmosphere, incredible pizza, but service.. If you don’t want your guests to come in 5 minutes before closing (9pm) especially in summer time. Just turn off the sign! I don’t appreciate you making me feel unwelcome.

I had two visits to Pizzeria Lucca while staying in Atlanta.  It was amazing! I will be back.  Love supporting small business owners that provide an excellent experience.  Especially when it comes to food.

If you are here from Italy like my wife and her mother you'll love this pizza it's as good as pizza in Naples Italy from what they say and I can tell you as an American it's some of the best pizza I've ever had.
Love the fig and procuitto pizza! Friendly staff as always!

Solid wood fire pizza. Quite similar to the pizza I've had in Italy, thin crust, soft. The crust is top notch, but was not a huge fan of the toppings.  I will avoid and just get cheese from now on.   Inside is kind of dressy picnic tables, …

I found my new favorite pizza joint! I once thought Anticos would never be dethroned, but Pizzeria Lucca has them beat by a mile. The staff is very friendly and makes you feel welcome as soon as you walk in. Pizzeria Lucca is much larger and finding a table is very easy, even for a large group.  The best part of it all is that they allow you to customize your pizza and add or subtract toppings to your liking.  In sum, this is a must stop pizzeria for anyone looking for the best and most authentic pizza in the metro Atlanta area.
Great food, great service, great spot!

I saw this on Atlanta Eats and was very excited to give it a try! My husband and I enjoy trying out local businesses. On the way I decided to read a few reviews, mostly because I find them to be hilarious. My first job was at a restaurant and geez do people enjoy complaining! However, to my surprise I was appalled! Not by the reviews but from the response from the owner! I mean yes, people complain but to respond by telling them to enjoy eating somewhere else and essentially blaming everybody else without taking any responsibility EVER!? I get defending your business to the extend of saying I'm sorry you didn't enjoy your experience. As the owner, playing the blame game presives you as incredibly ridiculous. Take the high road every once in a while. Unfortunately this bothered me to the point we decided to spend our money elsewhere I'm sure this was our loss. At the end of the day, it doesn't matter how great your establishment is, if you continue to treat customers in this way you'll eventually run of out of customers! Especially when there are soooo many pizza places.
One of the best pies I've had since leaving Boston!
Ever since I came back from New York City I have been looking for a local pizza joint that has as good of pizza as Juliana's. I have to say I have finally found the place.
Great family friendly pizzeria. Fresh ingredients and good atmosphere. Check it out.
Good pizza, thin crust, quickly served
We love to come here.  Delicious Pizza.
It was a great family friendly place and close to home!!
Best pizza ever. The crust is phenomenal.
Pizza was amazing! Hot, fresh and delicious!!!

Delicious pizza. Very kind staff and affordable prices. The restaurant atmosphere was also very warm and felt open. Will definitely be back again.  We were also impressed by the “promotions” offered. Certain days were BYOB and awesome drink deals.
Just like Antico pizza

I've only gotten takeout from here, but the Lucca Pizza is very good.  Service has been excellent they have had my pizza right on time every time.  We also got the New York style pizza another time which I thought was very good.  Parking is a little awkward an it's hard to get in from the 120 side in the afternoon.  I think you can get in from Mimosa St. but I haven't tried it.
Very good pizza. Fresh and with interesting combinations. Fig and arugula was a great combination.
Some of the best pizza north of Atlanta! Family friendly. Different specials on different week nights. They even have a BYOB night.
Amazing
Great pizza and environment.
Meatball app is soooooo good. Awesome crust on the pizza. One of my favorite pizza spots.
Great pizza, relaxed atmosphere.

Good service. Delicious thin crust pizzas. The Greek salad was very good. The seating at long wooden tables, the open kitchen and the casual atmosphere add to the experience. Simple and worth visiting. Definitely a "come back" place.
Excellent pizza and environment.

went in with a 2year old for dinner because of the convenient location. it was the second time for us after going right after opening(his first b-day). Well, i asked for any kids menu options and nothing except for cheese pizza. asked for some(any kind) of sauce, garlic or any other, they have none. asked for a lid and straw for the plastic cup(remember, 2year old in tow). they have none. heard someone ask for a wifi password, they don’t have wifi for customers yet(opened for over a year) ordered a prosciutto pizza. it was ok. prices are on par with the likes of Antico and Campania, but pizza doesn’t really compare. again, not bad but not close to the ones mentioned. menu way thinner than the other two. It will be the last time for us,the 15-20 min drive to Avalon or to Campania is definitely worth the different experience.

My Son and Wife with My Grands (ages 4.9 and 2.8), joined us for a delicious pizza Sunday Dinner.  LUCCA is a great place to casually dine. Large white picnic tables with benches fill this Dining Room. In great weather, there are  outside screened tables. Lioht rock croons in the background serenely. Great place for children of all ages. Upon arriving, part of your group can go find a table and the rest can stand and order. You do get a number stand, so they can bring your delectable ooey gooey pizzas to your table. You. Deliver the metal personal pizza size plates to your table. They have plenty of staff to help with the drinks. As a real treat, you can watch them pump out the pizza in fire wall ovens imported from Italy. We ordered 3 pies, with extra lunch slices. So good. The sauce is awesome, the crust is wonderful.  I usually give the Hubs my crust, but not at LUCCA'S  !! Sausage was spicy as promised with fresh lumps of  mozzarella and basil. Cheese pizza with onions -who la la ! Imported and IPA beers and Wine are easily purchased. Pink lemonade for the Kids ! You can even order desert, if you can ! Great place . Good  Food, Efficient Staff, Clean Bathrooms and and about approximately  $10.00 +-  per person for the Best Pizza.  Handicapped entrance, ample parking, Honors debit/credit cards. And it's in ROSWELL. !! (Roswell Rd and 1 blockish  on Marietta Hwy,  right side. Hours are posted on doors.
Great Neapolitan style pizza in a neighborhood pizza place.

Unapologetic commitment to the highest quality food and comfort of guests in a relaxed atmosphere. This is authentic, not a fast food pizza place (although the speed with which we got our pizza was phenomenal).  My 14 year old nephew can recognize the difference and appreciate it, as well as the crafted cheesecake for a desert. A taste of gourmet authenticity.
Not as good as my first visit but not bad. Had the bianca, fig and prosciutto pie. Too sweet for us. Good service though.
Sorry another mediocre pizza place.
Great pizza
Excellent!
We have had Pizza Lucca several times and have never been disappointed. The pizza is delicious!!! I love this place and will continue coming back!
The pizza was outstanding. Very friendly service and hospitality. The price was just about right. Will come here again when in the area.
Great wood fired pizza. Lots of seating and friendly service.

I can’t believe all of the 5 star ratings for this place, maybe I went on an off day. I had really high hopes for Pizza Lucca, I saw that all of the ingredients were fresh and looked very good and that they were using wood burning ovens. Then it all went downhill, we ordered a NY Cheese and a Lucca and 3 drinks and it was just under $50.00. This is outrageous for pizza for lunch. This just isn’t for Pizza Lucca but almost every pizza place around Atlanta, you all overcharge for pizza like I have never seen before. I’m from Philadelphia and I have worked in several pizza & sandwich shops. It’s a rite of passage for Philadelphians. I couldn’t spend this much on good pizza if I tried. I don’t get you people from Atlanta. You gladly overpay for mediocre pizza all the time. A good large cheese pizza is $12 or less, no questions asked. This allows for quality ingredients and a profit for the owner. Any place that tells you that they have to charge more because of the costs is a bad business manager, a liar or just likes to gouge their customers. The Lucca pie should be priced at $18. Getting back to pizza Lucca, we received the two pies that we ordered and they looked odd. The crust ring was burnt in spots, not charred but burnt and in-between the burnt crust the crust was an odd color of whitish yellowish dough. The crust’s taste was very off putting. My daughter who loves to eat pizza crust wouldn’t touch it. When I went to pick up a slice, it just flopped. The base crust was soupy, limp and wet. When you pick up a slice and fold it in half it should be able to stay folded and hold it’s toppings without drooping and having the toppings slide out. The ingredients used were of very high quality and very tasty but the dough and the way it was cooked was just bad. We are always in search of good pizza that is reasonably priced in the North suburbs and boy were we disappointed with Pizza Lucca. As we were leaving the owner asked us what we thought of their pizza and not wanting to tell the truth I told him we thought it was awful, the crust was wet and soupy and he told me that is how good Neapolitan pizza was made. When I disagreed he got upset with me. We took the remaining pizza home thinking that reheating it on our pizza stone might save it a little but my daughter refused to eat it because of how bad it tasted earlier at lunch and my wife convinced me to just throw it away and chalk it up to just another overpriced bad pizza place in the Atlanta suburbs. I looked up a pizza place that when I was a kid we would got to for lunch during high school. A large 18 inch sausage pizza that would blow any place in Atlanta way was $14.75. The same meal at this place that would leave you begging for more would have cost me $32.55 plus tax. I asked my daughter and wife if they would give it another try as maybe we went on an off day and they both said not a chance, it was just too bad and expensive the first time. In response to the owner, this conversation did happen. I was there with my family after my daughter’s soccer game on 9/23/17 and we spent $45.26. Maybe it didn’t happen in your head because someone called you out on your soggy wet droopy pizza and you didn’t want to hear it. Maybe this will spark your memory. When I told you it was bad, I picked up a slice top show you how soggy wet droopy it was and that REAL pizza, when bent in half should never flop.
The pizza and atmosphere here are wonderful. Very family friendly place. We love going here with our kids and other families. Oh, and the pizza!  It doesn’t get much better than this.
Love this place. Pies are great.
Good but overpriced
Unbelievable pizza.  The absolute best in the city.  Fun atmosphere and great food at a fair price.  If you haven't been here you are missing out!

I have nothing but good things to say about this cute place.  Pizza, superb...meatballs, out of this world...salads are delish. The staff is friendly and accommodating. I highly recommend. Oh and I know a little something about pizza being that I lived it NY my whole life 😁.
Really great pizza that competes with Anticos. The Lucca and Tropea are delicious. Locally owned and operated. Service is casual but extremely friendly.
Very delicious pizzas, great salads and wonderful service
